messageBody:
I guess you made the dialog modal. There's a flag for that in the JDialog
constructor.

There are two approaches I have used in that situation:
1. Provide a constructor which opens the dialog in non-modal mode just for
testing purposes.

2. Open the dialog in another thread than the testing thread:
private void openDialogInOtherThread() {
Runnable runnable = new Runnable() {
public void run() {
dialog.show(); // = dialog.setVisible(true)
}
};
new Thread(runnable).start();
waitForDialogOpen();
}
private void waitForDialogOpen() {
while (!dialog.isShowing()) {
try {
Thread.sleep(10);
} catch (InterruptedException e) {
}
}
}


Now you can perform your tests on dialog as you wish. Don't forget to call
dialog.dispose() in tearDown.

Hope that helps,
Johannes
